revised_title: The Fine Structure of Conifer Tracheid Walls and their Optical Properties
tldr: The authors studied the fine structure of conifer tracheid walls, specifically the primary and secondary layers, in Pinus insignis. They discovered that the cellulose chains in the primary layer have a pseudo-transverse orientation, which is different from the secondary layer. This finding challenges previous theories about the relationship between the primary wall structure and tracheid length. The authors also examined the mechanisms of chain orientation in elongated cells and discussed the implications of their findings.
